clinical_study.brief_title: Histologic Response to UVA and UVB Exposure During the Use of Sunscreen
clinical_study.official_title: Histologic Response to UVA and UVB Exposure During the Use of Sunscreen With Anti-inflammatory and Anti-oxidant Properties - A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant agents have become the important ingredients in sunscreen. However, there is no histologic study about the effects of anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative properties of sunscreen to prevent premature aging from UVA and UVB.

detailed_description.textblock: Premature aging can be prevented by using sunscreen. Currently, anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant agents have become the important ingredients in sunscreen. However, there is no histologic study about the effects of anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative properties of sunscreen to prevent premature aging from UVA and UVB.

primary_outcome.description: Review difference in H&E staining in tissue biopsy before and after UVA / UVB irradiation

secondary_outcome.description: Review difference in Tyrosinase staining in tissue biopsy before and after UVA / UVB irradiation to evaluate the effects of pigment darkening after UV exposure

other_outcome.description: Review difference in 8-OH-dG staining in tissue biopsy before and after UVA / UVB irradiation to evaluate the quantity of free radical species after UV exposure
Review difference in MMP1 staining in tissue biopsy before and after UVA / UVB irradiation to evaluate the collagen and ground substances destruction after UV exposure

arm_group.description: Apply sunscreen before and after UVA and UVB irradiation

intervention.description: Apply sunscreen before and after UVA and UVB irradiation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjects aged 35-65 years who were scheduled for abdominoplasty
- the excised area should be larger than 18x10 cm2
- no skin diseases or lesions on the excised area
- no topical treatment on excised area more than 1 month prior to this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- lactation
- have tattoo or striae distensae on abdomen
